intro: Impatiens gossweileri, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It is characterized by its velvety, dark green foliage and produces clusters of small, showy flowers in shades of pink, purple, and white. The plant belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is often cultivated as a popular ornamental plant due to its compact growth habit and ability to thrive in shaded environments. Impatiens gossweileri prefers moist, well-draining soil and is typically grown as a houseplant or in greenhouse conditions. Its unique beauty and adaptability make it a favorite among plant enthusiasts.
